SEARCH
Package cz.cvut.fel.omo.semestral.entity.beings

Class Human

java.lang.Object
cz.cvut.fel.omo.semestral.entity.beings.Being
cz.cvut.fel.omo.semestral.entity.beings.Human
All Implemented Interfaces:
Tickable
public class Human extends Being implements Tickable
Represents a human being in the smart home simulation. This class extends the Being class and adds human-specific functionalities.

  • Field Summary

    • Human

      public Human(int beingID, String name, Room room, ManualRepo manualRepo, Queue<Action> actionPlan)
      Constructs a new Human with the specified name, action plan, and initial room.
      Parameters:
      beingID - The ID of the human.
      name - The name of the human.
      room - The initial room where the human is located.
      actionPlan - The queue of actions that this human will perform.

  • Method Details

    • sendUserInput

      protected void sendUserInput(DeviceSystem deviceSystem, Action action)
      Sends user input to a specified device system. This method simulates the interaction of the human with a device in the smart home.
      Parameters:
      deviceSystem - The device system to receive the input.
      action - The type of user action.

    • feed

      public void feed(Human human)
      Simulates the action of this human feeding another human.
      Parameters:
      human - The human being fed.

    • onTick

      public void onTick()
      Description copied from class: Being
      Method called on each tick of the simulation. Subclasses should override this method to define behavior that occurs on each tick.

    • performNextAction

      public void performNextAction()
      Performs the next action in the action plan. This method handles being-specific actions and delegates device interactions to the appropriate device systems.
      Specified by:
      performNextAction in class Being

    • doSport

      public void doSport(SportEquipmentType sportEquipment)
      Engages the human in a sporting activity using the specified sport equipment. This method prints a message indicating the start of the sport with the given equipment and marks the equipment as being used.
      Parameters:
      sportEquipment - The sport equipment to be used in the activity.

    • stopSport

      public void stopSport(SportEquipmentType sportEquipment)
      Stops the sporting activity involving the specified sport equipment. This method prints a message indicating the end of the sport with the given equipment and marks the equipment as not being used.
      Parameters:
      sportEquipment - The sport equipment that was used in the activity.

    • findDeviceSystemInRoom

      public DeviceSystem findDeviceSystemInRoom(UserInputType inputType)
      Finds a device system in the current room that can handle a given type of user input.
      Parameters:
      inputType - The type of user input for which to find the device system.
      Returns:
      The device system that can handle the given input type, or null if none is found.

    • accept

      public Report accept(ReportVisitor visitor)
      Accepts a visit from a ReportVisitor, allowing the visitor to perform operations specific to the type of this object. This method is a part of the Visitor design pattern and is used to generate a report based on the type of Human.
      Parameters:
      visitor - The ReportVisitor visiting this object.
      Returns:
      A Report object specific to the type of this object, as generated by the visitor.
